name: Countering Emotional Manipulation in Groups
description: Tactical strategies for disrupting emotional control mechanisms in social structures.

cards.title: Emotional Calibration in High-Pressure Environments
cards.description: Maintaining emotional control when PSNs attempt to induce panic, rage, or guilt.
bulletpoints: PSNs manufacture urgency and emotional overdrive to control decisions.
Training in controlled emotional responses creates resistance to manipulation.
Strategic non-reactivity disrupts the effectiveness of emotional baiting.

cards.title: Breaking the Peer Conformity Reflex
cards.description: Building resistance to social coercion in controlled group settings.
bulletpoints: Group dynamics often override individual critical thinking.
Encouraging people to make small independent choices builds autonomy.
Publicly modeling independent thought creates a ripple effect of resistance.

cards.title: Dismantling False Group Identity
cards.description: Exposing how PSNs manipulate the human need for belonging.
bulletpoints: PSNs create artificial in-group vs. out-group dynamics to enforce loyalty.
Showing how identities are externally imposed rather than freely chosen weakens attachment.
Reintroducing individual identity beyond the group reinforces independent decision-making.
